FullText:
Frog, Giant Abyssal Dire

This frog appears to be about 12 feet long. Its skin is blackish-green and constantly oozes a milky slime from its body.



Giant Abyssal Dire Frog

CR 4

XP 1,200
CE Large outsider (augmented animal, extraplanar)
Init +8; Senses darkvision 60 ft., low-light vision, scent; Perception +8
DEFENSE
AC 24, touch 14, flat-footed 20 (+4 Dex, +10 natural, -1 size)
hp 58 (4d8+36)
Fort +13, Ref +10, Will +4
Resist ance cold 5, fire 5; SR 9
OFFENSE
Spd 40 ft., swim 40 ft.
Melee bite +10 (1d8+8 plus grab) or
tongue +10 touch (grab)
Space 10 ft.; Reach 10 ft. (20 ft. with tongue)
Special Attacks pull (tongue, 10 feet), smite good 1/day (+4 damage), swallow whole (1d8+8 bludgeoning damage, AC 12, 2 hp), tongue
STATISTICS
Str 27, Dex 19, Con 28, Int 5, Wis 16, Cha 14
Base Atk +3; CMB +12 (+16 grapple); CMD 26 (30 vs. trip)
Feats Improved Initiative, Lightning Reflexes
Skills Acrobatics +13 (+17 jumping), Perception +8, Stealth +4, Swim +16; Racial Modifiers +4 Acrobatics (+8 jumping), +4 Stealth
Languages Abyssal
ECOLOGY
Environment Plane of Slime
Organization solitary or pair
Treasure none


Giant Abyssal dire frogs come from the Plane of Slime and are wholly evil. They have a demonic aspect to them, with a spiny and usually poisonous hide. Their red eyes flicker with demonic intelligence.

Credit The Giant Abyssal Dire Frog made its d20 debut in the Necromancer Games module D1 Tomb of Abysthor.

Copyright Notice Authors Scott Greene and Clark Peterson, based on original material by Gary Gygax.
